channel.title: Need help with 508 stupid client error
channel.description:
when i run the client i get this error about a js5io if uve had this error and fixed it tell me how please dont "suggest" anything unless you no its going to fix it ------------- stupid questions your going to ask and there answers Did you run the server first? yes i did
did u fix up the 508cache folder? yes i did
what client are you using? im on paldinos original client
anyways will rep if u help me :)

item.title: Need help with 508 stupid client error
item.dc:creator: @King_Lingerz King Lingerz
item.description:
@King_Lingerz wrote:

Okay, you need the server running and the client trying to acess the ip 127.0.1
To check if it is, go into client.java in Pali’s client and search 127.0.1, if you cant find it search for:

    Class68_Sub9.aString2883 = "

Then put it like this:

    Class68_Sub9.aString2883 = "127.0.1";

That tells your client to connect to your server that your running. If that doesn’t work, I don’t know, sorry.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 30, 2008, 03:56:12 pm[/size][hr]Okay, you need the server running and the client trying to acess the ip 127.0.1
To check if it is, go into client.java in Pali’s client and search 127.0.1, if you cant find it search for:

    Class68_Sub9.aString2883 = "

Then put it like this:

    Class68_Sub9.aString2883 = "127.0.1";

Save and Compile.

That will tell your client to connect to your server that your running. If that doesn’t work, I don’t know, sorry.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with 508 stupid client error
